intro: Burmeistera millei, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. Burmeistera millei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators like hummingbirds.
